intro: Lepidium cartilagineum, commonly known as the bladder campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm. The plant features small, white or pinkish flowers clustered in racemes, and its leaves are usually alternate and lance-shaped. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. The plant is characterized by its inflated, bladder-like seed pods that split open when mature to disperse seeds.
